text: Tom Smith (31 October 1971 - 6 April 2022) was an English-born former Scotland international rugby union losehead prop. He played for Glasgow Warriors, Caledonia Reds and Northampton Saints and also represented the British and Irish Lions. He was a rugby coach. Smith was born in London. In November 2019, Smith was diagnosed with terminal colon that metastasized spread to his brain and liver. He died from the disease on 6 April 2022, aged 50. ==References== ==Other websites== *Sporting Heroes profile Category:1971 births Category:2022 deaths Category:English rugby union players Category:Deaths from colorectal cancer Category:Sportspeople from London
